attributes.action: Make Government time immediately available to repeal Expats 15 year voting limit
attributes.background: In the recent Referendum vote, many British subjects were prevented from voting on a matter which could potentially affect their lives because they have lived and worked abroad for more than 15 years. Government time is needed in Parliament immediately to enable a promise by David Cameron to be kept
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon David Cameron recently stated that there was an intention to repeal this limit but no time was available before the Referendum. Since the "Leave" vote will compel a new programme of legislation when Parliament returns after Recess an opportunity exists to progress this. A Bill was introduced by Geoffrey Clifton-Brown MP in 2014 but failed for lack of time despite strong Conservative support. This should be immediately reintroduced in Government time not by a Private Member

attributes.action: Dissolve Parliament after leadership elections to trigger a General Election
attributes.background: I believe that no public mandate exists for the incumbent government and the period of government following the EU referendum is too important to proceed without such a mandate.

attributes.action: Give all 16 and 17 year olds the vote in referenda that affect their future
attributes.background: In the June 2016 referendum on whether to remain in the UK, 16 and 17 year old citizens have been denied a say on this important question, yet will endure its consequences for the next 60 to 70 years. Their fate has been decided by older people who have less at stake. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens who are resident in the UK to vote in any future UK referendum
attributes.background: In the recent 2016 UK referendum, EU citizens that had been living AND working in the UK for more than 5 years were unable to vote on a referendum that would directly affect their lives. These people are net contributors, both economically and socially to the UK and should not be devalued.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Migration Impact Fund
attributes.background: The first Cameron ministry scraped the Migration Impact Fund in 2010. The £50million fund was set up by the Brown ministry to help local government deal with the effects of pressure of high levels of immigration. By reintroducing this fund we can ensure that migration benefits everyone in society.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2010/aug/06/fund-impact-immigration-scrapped

attributes.action: Stop the Boundary Commission splitting Great Grimsby into two constituencies
attributes.background: Parliamentary boundaries define the area where a person votes for their local MP – their parliamentary constituency. A boundary review examines these areas and makes proposals for a new set of boundaries which are fairer and more equal, while also trying to reflect GEOGRAPHIC FACTORS and LOCAL TIES.
attributes.additional_details: The Boundary Commission’s proposal to cut our historic town completely down the middle therefore makes no sense, separating the famed docks in East Marsh Ward from the centrepiece People’s Park in Park Ward and the River Freshney in Freshney Ward from the ancient village in Scartho Ward. The proposal is unfair, undemocratic and unacceptable and is based on an out-of-date version of the electoral register. Sign this petition and keep the town of Great Grimsby in one seat.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell lilies without a clear label stating they kill cats.
attributes.background: Lilies are among one of the most common flowers sold in the UK. They are also toxic and fatal to the most common pet in the UK: cats. They are so lethal to cats that even just a cat brushing passed a lily and catching some pollen on its fur and then licking it off will shut down a cat's kidneys.
attributes.additional_details: My 8 month old cat passed away by coming into contact with a lily. She was in intensive care for two days, her kidneys shut down, she was aggressively twitching, she could not move and as her kidneys could not process and remove her potassium levels she died of a heart attack. All it takes is a cat to ingest the tiniest bit of pollen and they will die. How can it be that all lilies sold do not come with a clear warning? It is disgusting. I lost my sweet young girl, don't let this happen again.

attributes.action: Record biometric data for all migrants and refugees entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background: To protect UK citizens from criminal or terrorist acts by refugees and migrants and to protect those refugees and migrants from exploitation and harm. Obtaining biometric data will remove anonymity, allowing the welfare of migrants to be monitored and providing a deterrent to crime and terrorism.

attributes.action: Candidates for positions of power must declare all associations to Organizations
attributes.background: When we have elections for Police Commissioners, MPs, Mayors etc, we should have the right to know what organizations the candidate are a member of so we can make a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: More and more positions of power within the Police, Army, Government & finance appear to being held by people who don't seem to represent the best interests of the people, this is one way of giving people more choice of who they want to represent them. We should be informed so that we can choose between people who put the interests of the people first or the interests of an Organization (secret or otherwise) causing a conflict of interest. Any person who fails to declare association with any society, Party or Organization (secret or Open)  should be removed from the position they hold

attributes.action: Provide food, shelter, rehabilitation and caring for every homeless person
attributes.background:
The homeless situation in Britain is a terrible stain on our home nations.  Having anybody living on the streets in such a developed society is deplorable.

To let it happen because it is felt that people have fell through the cracks, don't try or have chosen their misfortune is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that as much as 25% of homeless people are ex service personal.

People in derived areas are doubly jeopardised by not having life chances of an affluent, structured, stable upbringing and are more susceptible to finding themselves on the fringes of society.

This is the age of one nation Britain and we need to care and nurture all.

We would like to see Parliament open up homeless rehabilitation centres to be able to accommodate everybody on the streets, to get their life back

attributes.action: Make all anti-depressants free on the NHS
attributes.background: Anti-depressant tablets are needed by a large proportion of the U.K population - why should people have to pay for these when they desperately need them. Mental illnesses should be treated the same way as physical: in the way that for example Thyroid tablets are free, anti-depressants should be.

attributes.action: Reinstate the 2006 plan for all new homes built after 2016 to be zero carbon.
attributes.background: The plan would have ensured that all new dwellings from 2016 would generate as much energy on-site – via renewable sources, e.g. wind or solar energy – as they would use in heating, hot water, lighting and ventilation. This would be alongside tighter energy efficiency standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero Carbon homes are not more expensive - designers at Cardiff University built a zero carbon house at no extra cost here: (http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-33544831). Also, they will be cheaper to run as energy costs could be zero or even negative, therefore earning the owners money.
As well as the economic benefits of zero carbon homes, reducing carbon emissions is also important for climate change; and reducing energy dependency on other countries (i.e. by importing gas and oil)

attributes.action: Allow tax-paying UK residents to vote in general elections and referendums
attributes.background:
Excluding tax paying immigrants from the voting population makes the vote less representative of the will of the UK because it silences a very important part of the engine of the country.
Let's make sure going forward all the people who love and work hard for this country have a say in its future.

attributes.action: Do not trigger Article 50 until second EU referendum.
attributes.background: The current divide following 1st EU referendum means that the population is not represented at all, and the campaign was based on misleading information.

attributes.action: Patient centered treatment for pernicious anemia/ b12 injections.
attributes.background: People with b12 deficiency have quarterly b12 injections most patients feel this is not regular enough and despite asking doctors you have to wait 3 months and have to feel the ill effects this gives people, which is linked to a lot of further health problems.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2191161/The-60p-injection-boost-flagging-energy.html

attributes.action: Gerard Batten, to lead the delegation negotiating terms for leaving the EU
attributes.background: Before I decided on this petition I spoke to five Conservative friends and three Socialist friends who were all for Leaving, and they said they could support my idea.
attributes.additional_details:
There are huge pitfalls if the Leave campaign wins the referendum. Article50 is the worst, the Norwegian and Swiss options are not necessary for the fifth strongest economy in the world.

Mr Batten has written an excellent book ”The Road to Freedom: How Britain Can Escape the EU” showing the traps and tricks that Article50 invokes so that we could be kept in each 'two year period' indefinitely. As Nigel Farage is a little like Marmite (people either love him or hate him) Mr Batten would be an ideal replacement.

attributes.action: UK govt to strongly condemn India for genocide of innocent Kashmiri muslims
attributes.background: Kashmiri muslims are asking for their right of freedom, which was conferred to them according to UN resolutions. They want Their right of plebiscite. Indian army is killing innocent and unarmed Kashmiri Muslims. Killings should be stopped immediately and Kashmiri should be invited for dialogue.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to send in the Army to protect lorry Drivers in France.
attributes.background: Due to increase on attacks to lorry drivers in Calais France before someone gets killed or serious injury to send over troops to protect the drivers and their lorries also the cost to damaged or soiled goods and maybe the destruction of businesses.

attributes.action: Reconsider changing bursaries to loans for Student Nurses and Midwives.
attributes.background: The government has recently voted to remove the NHS Bursary for Student Nurses and Midwives. Student Nurses and midwives work 37.5 per hours a week on placement, they should not have to pay for the privilege of becoming nurses, when they already work for that money!

attributes.action: Independent review on which voting system delivers the greatest representation.
attributes.background: The current First Past the Post voting system is delivering Governments voted for by the largest minority of voters, not the majority, but there are disagreements over which system would deliver the greatest representation, AV. AV+, STV, PR. An independent review is needed to answer this question.
attributes.additional_details:
More information on the different types of voting systems can be found on the internet, once site being
http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/voting-systems
Many other Countries use different systems, Scotland uses the STV system for its local elections.

attributes.action: Allow NON-EU parents/ family members of British Citizens to settle in UK.
attributes.background:
Following my dad's terminal illness, my family (I, my wife & son) relocated to India in 2014 to look after my dad & support my mum.
Since I have lost my dad, we want to return home (London) but I can't leave my elderly mum (who has already gone through a lot since 2012) on her own in India.
attributes.additional_details:
I, my wife & son are UK Citizens. We own a house in London & had decent jobs in financial service industry until we moved our center of life to India in Apr'14.
Following my dad's demise, I'm desperate to return to our home in London but are forced to stay in India as UK won't let my mum in to settle & I can't leave her alone!  UK allows non EU family of EU immigrants under EU law but can't do the same for it's own citizens. Is this the price we have to pay for being UK citizens & tax payers?

attributes.action: Include all armed services veterans on the 2021 census
attributes.background: Our armed services form a historical and vital part of our community. Although the service records are there we just do not know how many veterans are still with us or where. This would help the Government to plan and possibly allocate resources to areas with a high veteran population.
attributes.additional_details: By including veterans into the census this would bring to the veterans a sense that they are really valued by us all.

attributes.action: Offer financial support for students who have had to defer for medical reasons.
attributes.background: If a full time university student has to defer the course due to medical reasons, there are no provisions in place to prevent them from becoming homeless or to access financial support. Many students defer each year and are forced to give up their education in order to claim state benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
Department for Work and Pensions regulations do not consider deferred students, even if they are signed off sick by their GP. 

Housing benefit do not consider deferred students even if they have dependent children. 

Student Finance England can only provide up to 60 days worth of funding if you provide adequate evidence for the reason why you've had to defer. 

Universities have grants for those in hardship but have a yearly allowance. You cannot go over this limit under any circumstances.

attributes.action: Stop fracking exploration in Teesside, revoke licenses granted to Third Energy
attributes.background: Third Energy has recently been granted permission to explore for shale gas in and around the Teesside area. The areas they have been granted are heavily populated and also nature reserves and fracking would destroy these areas of beauty.

attributes.action: Make breeding animals without a licence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Each year "ALMOST 50,000 pet dogs are being dumped by owners in Britain every year – with healthy animals being exterminated every TWO hours by agencies who are struggling to cope".  "Authorities killed 5,142 stray dogs last year as Britain's abandoned pet crisis shows little sign of being solved".
attributes.additional_details: If animals weren't so readily available to buy on the internet/private sales, if demand was far greater than the supply thus prices weren't so competitive/affordable then people wouldn't be so quick to buy one and be so irresponsible and careless once they become pet owners.  I would like licensed breeders ONLY to sell pets in order for the government to have better control over the pet population/welfare,  and a better approach to who animals are sold to, some form of vetting would be ideal.

attributes.action: Make pet shops pass a test before selling their animals
attributes.background: Many pet shops are giving the wrong advice about their animals, especially exotics, to first time owners and unfortunately they don't know it could be harming their pet. Pet shops should pass a test on each animal they sell to prevent this from happening.
attributes.additional_details:
The main issues are:
The wrong food 
Incorrect housing size/type
Incorrect size/type wheels (wire ones injure feet)
Telling people solitary animals "need a friend"
Incorrect bedding type (usually sawdust which is avoided by most people)
Failing to tell customers that CAPTIVE BRED ANIMALS SHOULD NOT BE RELEASED INTO THE WILD

attributes.action: Raise the student maintenance loan in Cambridge to match the London living costs
attributes.background: Living costs in Cambridge have considerably increased in the past 3 years. Yet, the loans given to students do not reflect this increase in the same way as they do for London students. The average rent for student accommodation in Cambridge is so high that currently loans do not cover the majority.

attributes.action: Extend the timetable for district councils to submit their Local plans
attributes.background: Plans based their housing numbers on several factors (migration, economic growth, etc). The data supporting these factors may no longer be valid given the significant risks that have emerged post BREXIT. Councils should be required to review the risks and reconfirm their housing requirements.

attributes.action: Referendum for the people to decide whether we should end the TV License Fee/Tax
attributes.background: The BBC coverage of the UK Referendum has not been free of political bias. Whether it comes to BBC News reporting, prominently featuring Remain side arguments and showing Leave side arguments playing second fiddle to the BBC Website which has done the same. As for the BBC Fact Checker that is biased

attributes.action: Hold an Emergency General Election, to be held no later than February 20th 2017.
attributes.background: In order to restore public faith in the Democratic process, the public should be given the option to affirm its faith in the current government or to overturn it in a General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May demanded the Same action when Gordon Brown took power in 2007.
The Fixed Term Parliament Act 2011 has provisions so that under certain circumstances a snap General Election may be held.
The Government has already Ignored numerous Petitions this year including the Largest Petition in British Political history.
The Leadership Crises that plagued almost all the Major Political Parties in Parliament should allow the British Public to have their say once again in a General Election.

attributes.action: Require the Department of Health to review outdated (1988) Child Growth Chart
attributes.background: Infants and Children's weight in the UK is measured on an outdated growth chart formulated in 1988 based on formula fed babies and children in 1988. This is wrongly leading to children and babies being "labelled" as obese from birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for this petition as today my health visitor advised me that my child who was born just above the 75th centile for weight and above the 98th centile for height is "overweight".  (Despite being breastfed on demand for 16 months of his life, as per best advice to breastfeed for the first year.)
Despite this the Health Visitor tells me that at any contact with a health professional we are likely to be advised about regulating his weight.

attributes.action: A constitution that forbids our Parliament ceding sovereignty to foreign powers.
attributes.background: This would prevent governments gradually ceding sovereignty to foreign powers as they have done for example over the last 44 years to the EU treaty by treaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Tony Benn on the Lisbon treaty & the EU > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTjg-vt0Ao4

'If parliament transfers sovereignty away in treaties such as Lisbon then it is stealing rights that don't belong to it because an MP is lent powers of the public for 5 years

But if in those 5 years you give it away to somebody else then you can't repeal those laws. This is a theft of public rights.'

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: Increase standard benefit amount for ESA, & improve screening process for PIP.
attributes.background:
Thousands of people are too scared to apply for benefits, due to fear of losing current benefits or being taken to court 

The amount for ESA is £57 per week. PIP is awarded if you qualify at a testing centre, where 'not looking tired enough' will get your application declined.
attributes.additional_details:
I am part of a fibromyalgia support page, and a bipolar support page. Both of these pages are full of people who are applying for PIP and ESA, and being turned down due to 'not looking tired enough' (fibromyalgia sufferer), 'being able to be woken up by strangers at their stop on a bus' (narcolepsy sufferer), 'being mobile' when the person has to use an electric wheelchair paid for by themselves due to benefit refusal (fibromyalgia sufferer) 

Austerity is being applied in the wrong places.

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Urge India to allow UNHRC intervention in Kashmir
attributes.background: On 17/08/16, the UNHRC stated that it 'could only assume the worst' following the failure of the Indian authorities to grant its office access to Kashmir. Recently, thousands of civilians have been injured by armed forces during continuing protests across the region. Death toll now exceeds 60.
attributes.additional_details: Refusal to allow a UNHRC visit comes at a time when the Indian state stands accused of using disproportionate force to crush protests. To date, military-occupied Kashmir has seen over 70000 killings, 8000+ enforced disappearances & countless cases of torture & sexual violence. The Indian state has given impunity to its armed forces so as to protect them from prosecution for international crimes, including war crimes. The state stands in violation of its own laws as well as international laws.

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.

attributes.action: Bring back A-level resits!
attributes.background: We want to bring back A-level resits for alll students across the UK. We want to be able to make sure you can resit your AS year and/or A2 year. It will enable students to have access to a second opportunity and allow them to attend University instead of missing out on the chance to prevail in life.
attributes.additional_details: By bringing back the AS/A2 resits, students will have the opportunity to achieve their highest aspirations in life instead of being set back due to one bad grade.

attributes.action: End the compulsory licence fee for those who do not use BBC services.
attributes.background: BBC channels are always included in media packages for television viewing whether paid versions or freeview versions. This then results in the compulsory purchase of a TV licence as the 'choice' to not use these services is removed.
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition is to end compulsory inclusion of BBC services in media packages and to therefore remove or vastly reduce the licence fee for those who do not choose to use the BBC services. We should not have to pay for services not required just because we have media viewing devices in our homes.

attributes.action: Provides refuge in the UK for our armed forces interpreters in all war zones
attributes.background: I served for 30 years in the RAF, I completed my service for my country in 2005. To read that the country I served for, is hanging out to dry, even signing the death warrant of those brave local people, and their families who assisted our personnel in recent war zones deeply upsets me.
attributes.additional_details:
Trade                    Aircraft Avionics
Rank                     Chief Technician
Last Posting         RAF Cosford

attributes.action: Rename the RRS Sir David Attenborough to RRS Boaty McBoatface
attributes.background: Britain is known worldwide for both it's excellent scientific research and sense of humour. NERC should accept the choice of RRS Boaty McBoatface (124,109 votes), rather than for RRS Sir David Attenborough (10,284 votes) and respect the true democratic result and excellent British wit.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties and punishments for bullies in school
attributes.background: Recently more and more children are being bullied and the incident is being posted on social media we need to show this is wrong and have stronger penalties and punishment for such behaviour to deter other people from doing it and show them this type of behaviour is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: boy 11 died due to bullying 29.9.16

attributes.action: Allow England to have its own Parliament devolved from Westminster.
attributes.background: Where Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland are allowed their own devolved parliaments so they can vote on laws specific to them without English interference, we desire our own parliament to vote on English specific laws, and to be granted the same rights and power.

attributes.action: Make it law for all horse riders to wear hi-viz clothing when riding on the road
attributes.background:
As a horse rider, nothing infuriates me more than other riders who risk themselves and their horses by hacking on roads not wearing hi-viz. 
We expect drivers and other road users to slow down when passing us so we should make sure we can be seen well in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
Wearing hi-viz increases visibility by seconds. 
By not wearing it riders increase the risk of accident.

Be safe, be seen!

attributes.action: Hold an all-party public inquiry into bullying and harassment in Parliament
attributes.background:
Recent difficulties in relations between MP's in the Labour Party have highlighted an endemic culture of bullying within HoC.

Bullying & harassment aren't accepted in any other workplace or institution in the UK. This toxic culture is harming individuals and politics more widely.
attributes.additional_details:
MP reduced to tears watching personal attacks at Labour leader designed to "Break him as a man": http://tinyurl.com/zl268n5

Some of these MPs have since stated they felt extreme pressure to vote "no confidence" in the leader

Conservative MPs have spoken out against bullying behaviour and how ineffective current anti-bullying measures are: http://tinyurl.com/z8se6nz

We need

* Full inquiry into bullying into HoC
* Measures to bring protection for MPs and HoC staff in line with other workplaces

attributes.action: Waive all fees for EU citizens applying for permanent residency or citizenship
attributes.background: The outcome of the EU referendum means that many EU citizens will be liable for fees amounting to several thousand pounds in order to secure their right to stay in the country.  It would be a great injustice given that they had no right to vote in this referendum.

attributes.action: Ban politicians from office who lie or deliberately/knowingly deceive the public
attributes.background: Recently there has been considerable deception on the part of politicians who appear to have deliberately deceived the British public on matters affecting the future well-being of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: A politician shown to have seriously lied or deliberately or knowingly deceived the public on important matters of national interest should be barred from holding any ministerial post in government.

attributes.action: In a 2nd independence referendum, Scots living outside Scotland will get a vote
attributes.background: The recent referendum on EU membership may now precipitate a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.  If the Scottish Government takes this step, then it is reasonable that Scottish-born people currently living outside of Scotland have a vote in such a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Scottish-born people, whether they are currently living in England or elsewhere, will be affected by the result of such a referendum, as it will have serious and life-changing implications for their future choice of nationality, citizenship and passport etc., both for themselves and for their descendants.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory in elections and referendums, similar to Australian law.
attributes.background: Voters are obliged to vote in elections or attend a poling station, or log a postal vote, if they do not they could be subject to a penalty, such as fines or community service. Currently there are 22 countries, including Australia, that have this system.
